pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were making elongated mouthfuls. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.3.1: “‘I will make rounded mouthfuls,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes an elongated mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.11: if it is a fresh food;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.12: if it is any kind of fruit;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.13: if it is a non-bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.16: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.17: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk40:1.18: The fourth sub-chapter on respectfully is finished.
